column3:
Go to the journal search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/

column4: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section, including 3 options for working with dates "limit by date range", "created date histogram" and "last update histogram"

column3: Open the "Limit by Date Range" facet and set a date range which gives you a subset of the data
Apply any other filters from the facets to further refine the search results

column4: An export section expands which includes a section to export the search results

column3: Enter a name for the export in the input box and click "Generate"

column4: a pop-up appears with a message that the export is being generated

column3:
Go to the background jobs page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/background_jobs

column4: The export job is listed with the name "admin_reports by [your username]" (it may have a status of queued or processing, or even complete)

column3: Wait for the job to complete (this can take up to 10 minutes).  You will need to refresh the page until it is in the "complete" status.
Open your "Notifications" menu at the top of the page

column4: A notification appears that the report is ready for download
A second notification saying a background job is finished will also be present

column3: Click on the notification that the report is ready for download

column4: A download box appears for the CSV file
The filename reflects the name you gave the export and the date requested

column3: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

column4: The CSV contains the data that was displayed in the search results
The CSV is the "admin" CSV, not the "public" CSV.  You can tell this because the final 3 columns include account information
